alert.note: Alert for Latah; Lewis; Nez Perce (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 03 at 9:51PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Idaho, including the following counties, Benewah, Latah, Lewis, Nez Perce and Shoshone. Portions of Southeast Washington, including the following counties, Asotin, Garfield and Whitman. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Area rivers, creeks, and small streams are on the rise due to melting snow from the unseasonably warm weather and heavy rain on snowmelt will exasperate runoff. Heavy rain may also cause flooding of urban areas and flash flooding or debris flows, especially in steep terrain and near burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Wet slow moving thunderstorms will develop across the southern to central Idaho Panhandle Thursday afternoon and track into southeast Washington during the evening hours. Thunderstorms will be capable of producing torrential downpours that could lead to flash flooding. Additional rain with showers will continue through Friday with rivers, small streams, and creeks remaining high. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
